result.execSummary:
The defendant Lori J Dejesus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Menards to be paid within the first 6 months of probation before costs and fines.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with Menards listed in the criminal complaint or St. Vincent DePaul on Sunset Drive.  Provide DNA sample unless previously obtained.  DNA Surcharge is waived.  Maintain employment and/or school combination.  Case 16CM24 was dismissed and read in. 
Mental Health Evaluation and Treatment deemed appropriate by the Agent.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  Release for standard conditions.  STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 43 days sentence credit.
Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
Probation revoked.  Sentence imposed.
(2) Character Letters, received and filed in court by Atty. LaTour.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lori J Dejesus in court, in custody, with attorney Jean Marie La Tour.   

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.

Court orders the following:
60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
43 Days Credit.

Any outstanding restitution/costs/fines/surcharges to be converted to a civil judgment.

Letter dated 2/2/17 filed by defendant requesting to be put back on probation or to have huber privileges.

filed by Atty La Tour.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Barry Braatz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lori J Dejesus in court with attorney Katherine Jean Graber.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended as agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Menard listed in the criminal complaint or St. Vincent DePaul on Sunset.
DNA sample to be provided.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by agent.

Restitution:  $40 (to be paid to Menards - to be paid first before costs/fines) - to be paid within first 6 months of probation.
Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
20 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.
